title: Korean Music - Jindo Funeral Songs (mp3 320)

Jindo Funeral Songs (mp3 320)
ÃƒÂ¬Ã‚Â§Ã¢â‚¬Å¾ÃƒÂ«Ã‚ï¿½Ã¢â‚¬Å¾ÃƒÂ«Ã‚Â§Ã…â€™ÃƒÂªÃ‚Â°Ã¢â€šÂ¬
Jindo Intangible Art Culture Series 5 (2007)


This CD contains 18 funeral songs from Jindo, an island off the southwest coast of Korea (click on my username for more music from Jindo). The first 10 tracks are performed by holders of the Jeollanamdo Provincial Intangible Cultural Property 19 (Jindo Manga) based in Inji village, Jisan-myeon. The remaining tracks are from Changyoo village, Jodo island (a small island about 45 minutes from Jindo).

I didn't write the track names here, but the tracks are labelled.

"When we perform our sacrificial ritual, after leveling the burial ground
We place fish to the east, meat west, red dish east, white dish west
Dried beef to the left, sweet rice drink to the right
How hard may I wail after your death
Would you know that I cry for you?
Why would I admit your death?
All kinds of delicacies after death
Not worth one drink during life"

Hope you enjoy. Click on my username for more Korean music. Happy new year!
